item.title: How not to bring a business to a new market: top 10 mistakes of founders
item.description: In recent months, Russian entrepreneurs have had to rethink their approaches to scaling abroad. Companies have shifted their focus from Western markets to other areas, such as Turkey, the United Arab Emirates, Latin America, and the CIS countries. Although these regions are no less promising, the founders often make the same mistakes that prevent them from gaining a foothold in new countries. 1. Fear of emerging markets Before February 2022, entrepreneurs tended to consider Europe and the US as target markets when scaling overseas.
